thread.title: Paramount Pictures releases over 100 free movies to YouTube
thread.title_full: Paramount Pictures releases over 100 free movies to YouTube - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Paramount Pictures releases over 100 free movies to YouTube
text:

He is charged with finding it, and through a series of comedic capers told through flashbacks, the viewer follows him along during his pursuit.

YouTube summary: Martin and Lewis run amok with... Image 36 of 36 Paramount Pictures releases over 100 free movies to YouTube 1 / 36 Back to Gallery Attention, movie lovers and cheap people craving free entertainment! Paramount Pictures has released more than 100 films on a free YouTube channel called the Paramount Vault .
The channel is a collection of Paramount full-length films and clips, including selections that range from black and white to color, comedy to horror, and everything in between.
RELATED: 31 scary movies you can rent tonight ... if you dare
Paramount writes in its "About" page that "viewers are invited to explore the vast landscape of cinema's history, share their favorite films, and discover new ones through this official channel created by Paramount Pictures."
The film studio dates back to 1912 and gave us classics like "Psycho" (1960), "The Godfather" (1972), "Titanic" (1997), and the first Academy Award winner for Best Picture, "Wings" (1927).
The majority of the motion pictures are lesser-known films — perfect for new discoveries.
Check out the films offered by Paramount in the slideshow above.
Movie buffs should enjoy this.
